meanings.sent1: The dark sorcerer was unhallowing the ancient temple with his sinister rituals.
meanings.sent2: The villain's evil deeds were unhallowing the once peaceful village.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous imp delighted in unhallowing the sacred garden by playing pranks on the monks.
meanings.sent4: The cursed amulet seemed to have a power that could unhallow even the purest of places.
meanings.sent5: The ominous clouds overhead seemed to unhallow the very ground they cast their shadows upon.

meanings.definition: The act of desecrating or profaning something sacred.
meanings.sent1: The unhallowing of the ancient shrine left the villagers in fear and disbelief.
meanings.sent2: The unhallowing of the sacred text was seen as a grave offense by the religious community.
meanings.sent3: The prankster's antics resulted in the unhallowing of the holy water, much to the dismay of the priests.
meanings.sent4: The unhallowing of the sacred ground was a stark reminder of the fragility of faith.
meanings.sent5: The unhallowing of the sacred relic brought a sense of foreboding to the once peaceful monastery.
